"Load More" : "Show Less"} </button> </div> </div> ); }; export default LandingPage; the search pop and the menu items for mobile version are hidden inside the fetured image fix that
ChatGPT said:

To fix the issue of the search pop-up and mobile menu items being hidden inside the featured image, you can make use of the z-index property to adjust the stacking order. We will ensure that the mobile menu and search pop-up are positioned above the image and are always visible.

Here's an updated version of your LandingPage component with the necessary adjustments:

  1. Ensure that the z-index of the search pop-up and menu items is higher than that of the image so that they appear above it.
  2. Add a position: relative to the wrapper divs for proper stacking.

Updated Code:

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import featimage from '../assets/featured.jpg';

const LandingPage = () => {
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [visibleBlogs, setVisibleBlogs] = useState(6); // Initially show 6 blogs

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch("https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?_embed")
      .then((res) => res.json())
      .then((data) => {
        setBlogs(data);
        setLoading(false);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error("Error fetching blogs:", err);
        setLoading(false);
      });
  }, []);

  // Function to decode HTML entities
  const decodeHtml = (html) => {
    const txt = document.createElement("textarea");
    txt.innerHTML = html;
    return txt.value;
  };

  const truncateExcerpt = (excerpt) => {
    const plainText = excerpt.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, ""); // Remove HTML tags
    return plainText.length > 100 ? `${plainText.slice(0, 100)}...` : plainText;
  };

  const toggleBlogs = () => {
    setVisibleBlogs((prev) => (prev === 6 ? blogs.length : 6)); // Toggle between 6 blogs and all blogs
  };

  if (loading) return <p className="p-6 text-center">Loading articles...</p>;

  return (
    <div className="p-6 lg:px-24 md:px-0">
      {/* Top Image Section */}
      <div className="relative mb-8 mx-2 z-0"> {/* z-0 to ensure it stays below menu items */}
        <img
          src={featimage}
          alt="Featured"
          className="w-full h-80 md:h-96 object-cover rounded-lg"
        />
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-blue-600 opacity-50 rounded-lg"></div>
        <div className="absolute inset-0 flex flex-col justify-center items-center z-20">
          <h2 className="text-white text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold text-center px-4">
            Explore Latest Articles Here, You Are Welcome!
          </h2>
          <p className="text-white text-sm md:text-base mt-2 text-center px-4">
            This site is created by Lokesh Singh Mewari for the SportsDuniya assignment.
          </p>
          <p className="text-white">We are using vedantatimes.com API</p>
        </div>
      </div>

      <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6 text-center">Latest Articles</h1>
      {/* Blue Horizontal Line */}
      <hr className="border-t-2 border-blue-600 mb-6" />

      <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4">
        {blogs.slice(0, visibleBlogs).map((blog) => {
          const featuredImage =
            blog._embedded?.["wp:featuredmedia"]?.[0]?.source_url;
          const decodedTitle = decodeHtml(blog.title.rendered); // Decode the title

          return (
            <div
              key={blog.id}
              className="border rounded-md p-4 shadow hover:shadow-lg transition"
            >
              {featuredImage && (
                <img
                  src={featuredImage}
                  alt={decodedTitle}
                  className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md mb-4"
                />
              )}
              <h3 className="font-bold text-xl mb-2">{decodedTitle}</h3> {/* Use decoded title */}
              <p className="text-gray-700 mb-4">
                {truncateExcerpt(blog.excerpt.rendered)}
              </p>
              <Link
                to={`/blogs/${blog.id}`}
                className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-600"
              >
                Read More
              </Link>
            </div>
          );
        })}
      </div>

      {/* Toggle Button */}
      <div className="text-center mt-6">
        <button
          onClick={toggleBlogs}
          className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-600"
        >
          {visibleBlogs === 6 ? "Load More" : "Show Less"}
        </button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default LandingPage;

Key Changes:

  1. Z-index Adjustments:

    • The z-index of the featured image's wrapper is set to z-0, ensuring that the menu and search items will be displayed above it.
    • The z-20 class is applied to the text content inside the featured image to make sure the heading and other elements are above the image.

  2. Search Pop-up and Menu Items:

    • If you have a search pop-up or menu component that is part of this page, ensure it is given a z-index value higher than z-0 to be displayed above the image.

You can customize this further depending on the specific layout of your search and menu components.

You said:
not fixed
ChatGPT said:

It seems the issue persists because of how the layout is structured, and we may need to make more adjustments to the z-index and positioning. To ensure that the mobile menu and search pop-up are above the featured image and not hidden, we will apply some more specific CSS fixes.

Heres what we can try:

  1. Set position: fixed for the menu and search pop-up to keep them fixed on the screen and visible above other content.
  2. Set z-index properly to ensure the menu and search pop-up are placed above the image.

Lets proceed with an updated approach.

Updated Code:

We will set the correct z-index values and adjust the positioning of the search and menu elements.

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import featimage from '../assets/featured.jpg';

const LandingPage = () => {
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [visibleBlogs, setVisibleBlogs] = useState(6); // Initially show 6 blogs

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch("https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?_embed")
      .then((res) => res.json())
      .then((data) => {
        setBlogs(data);
        setLoading(false);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error("Error fetching blogs:", err);
        setLoading(false);
      });
  }, []);

  // Function to decode HTML entities
  const decodeHtml = (html) => {
    const txt = document.createElement("textarea");
    txt.innerHTML = html;
    return txt.value;
  };

  const truncateExcerpt = (excerpt) => {
    const plainText = excerpt.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, ""); // Remove HTML tags
    return plainText.length > 100 ? `${plainText.slice(0, 100)}...` : plainText;
  };

  const toggleBlogs = () => {
    setVisibleBlogs((prev) => (prev === 6 ? blogs.length : 6)); // Toggle between 6 blogs and all blogs
  };

  if (loading) return <p className="p-6 text-center">Loading articles...</p>;

  return (
    <div className="p-6 lg:px-24 md:px-0">
      {/* Top Image Section */}
      <div className="relative mb-8 mx-2 z-0"> {/* Ensure it's below the pop-up */}
        <img
          src={featimage}
          alt="Featured"
          className="w-full h-80 md:h-96 object-cover rounded-lg"
        />
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-blue-600 opacity-50 rounded-lg"></div>
        <div className="absolute inset-0 flex flex-col justify-center items-center z-20">
          <h2 className="text-white text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold text-center px-4">
            Explore Latest Articles Here, You Are Welcome!
          </h2>
          <p className="text-white text-sm md:text-base mt-2 text-center px-4">
            This site is created by Lokesh Singh Mewari for the SportsDuniya assignment.
          </p>
          <p className="text-white">We are using vedantatimes.com API</p>
        </div>
      </div>

      <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6 text-center">Latest Articles</h1>
      {/* Blue Horizontal Line */}
      <hr className="border-t-2 border-blue-600 mb-6" />

      <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4">
        {blogs.slice(0, visibleBlogs).map((blog) => {
          const featuredImage =
            blog._embedded?.["wp:featuredmedia"]?.[0]?.source_url;
          const decodedTitle = decodeHtml(blog.title.rendered); // Decode the title

          return (
            <div
              key={blog.id}
              className="border rounded-md p-4 shadow hover:shadow-lg transition"
            >
              {featuredImage && (
                <img
                  src={featuredImage}
                  alt={decodedTitle}
                  className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md mb-4"
                />
              )}
              <h3 className="font-bold text-xl mb-2">{decodedTitle}</h3> {/* Use decoded title */}
              <p className="text-gray-700 mb-4">
                {truncateExcerpt(blog.excerpt.rendered)}
              </p>
              <Link
                to={`/blogs/${blog.id}`}
                className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-600"
              >
                Read More
              </Link>
            </div>
          );
        })}
      </div>

      {/* Toggle Button */}
      <div className="text-center mt-6">
        <button
          onClick={toggleBlogs}
          className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-600"
        >
          {visibleBlogs === 6 ? "Load More" : "Show Less"}
        </button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default LandingPage;

CSS Fixes for the Mobile Menu and Search Pop-up:

You can apply these classes globally or within the mobile menu and search pop-up components to fix the issue:

  1. Set the Mobile Menu and Search Pop-up Styles: In your CSS (or TailwindCSS if you're using it), you can add something like this:
css
/* Ensure that the mobile menu and search pop-up are above other content */
.menu, .search-popup {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 100%;
  z-index: 50; /* Higher z-index to stay above content */
}

.search-popup {
  z-index: 60; /* Optional: if you want search to be above the menu */
}
  1. Adjust Featured Image Section Z-Index: Since the featimage section may be interfering with the visibility of mobile menu items, ensure that its placed below the fixed elements like the search bar or the menu.
css
/* Featured image section */
.featured-image-container {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 0; /* Ensure it's below the
You said:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import featimage from '../assets/featured.jpg'; const LandingPage = () => { const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); const [visibleBlogs, setVisibleBlogs] = useState(6); // Initially show 6 blogs useEffect(() => { fetch("https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?_embed") .then((res) => res.json()) .then((data) => { setBlogs(data); setLoading(false); }) .catch((err) => { console.error("Error fetching blogs:", err); setLoading(false); }); }, []); // Function to decode HTML entities const decodeHtml = (html) => { const txt = document.createElement("textarea"); txt.innerHTML = html; return txt.value; }; const truncateExcerpt = (excerpt) => { const plainText = excerpt.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, ""); // Remove HTML tags return plainText.length > 100 ? ${plainText.slice(0, 100)}... : plainText; }; const toggleBlogs = () => { setVisibleBlogs((prev) => (prev === 6 ? blogs.length : 6)); // Toggle between 6 blogs and all blogs }; if (loading) return <p className="p-6 text-center">Loading articles...</p>; return ( <div className="p-6 lg:px-24 md:px-0"> {/* Top Image Section */} <div className="relative mb-8 mx-2 z-0"> {/* z-0 to ensure it stays below menu items */} <img src={featimage} alt="Featured" className="w-full h-80 md:h-96 object-cover rounded-lg" /> <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-blue-600 opacity-50 rounded-lg"></div> <div className="absolute inset-0 flex flex-col justify-center items-center z-20"> <h2 className="text-white text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold text-center px-4"> Explore Latest Articles Here, You Are Welcome! </h2> <p className="text-white text-sm md:text-base mt-2 text-center px-4"> This site is created by Lokesh Singh Mewari for the SportsDuniya assignment. </p> <p className="text-white">We are using vedantatimes.com API</p> </div> </div> <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6 text-center">Latest Articles</h1> {/* Blue Horizontal Line */} <hr className="border-t-2 border-blue-600 mb-6" /> <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4"> {blogs.slice(0, visibleBlogs).map((blog) => { const featuredImage = blog._embedded?.["wp:featuredmedia"]?.[0]?.source_url; const decodedTitle = decodeHtml(blog.title.rendered); // Decode the title return ( <div key={blog.id} className="border rounded-md p-4 shadow hover:shadow-lg transition" > {featuredImage && ( <img src={featuredImage} alt={decodedTitle} className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md mb-4" /> )} <h3 className="font-bold text-xl mb-2">{decodedTitle}</h3> {/* Use decoded title */} <p className="text-gray-700 mb-4"> {truncateExcerpt(blog.excerpt.rendered)} </p> <Link to={/blogs/${blog.id}} className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-600" > Read More </Link> </div> ); })} </div> {/* Toggle Button */} <div className="text-center mt-6"> <button onClick={toggleBlogs} className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-600" > {visibleBlogs === 6 ? "Load More" : "Show Less"} </button> </div> </div> ); }; export default LandingPage; import React, { useState } from "react"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons const Nav = () => { const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false); const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState(""); const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]); const toggleMenu = () => { setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen); }; const toggleSearchModal = () => { setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen); }; const handleSearch = async () => { if (searchKeyword.trim()) { const response = await fetch( https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword} ); const data = await response.json(); setSearchResults(data); } }; // Function to handle when a search result is clicked const handleResultClick = (id) => { // Close the search modal setIsSearchOpen(false); // Redirect to the post page window.location.href = /blogs/${id}; }; return ( <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 py-4 flex justify-between items-center relative"> {/* Logo */} <div className="text-2xl font-bold"> <Link to="/">The Dummy Times</Link> </div> {/* Mobile Menu Button */} <button className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none" onClick={toggleMenu} > {isMenuOpen ? ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" /> </svg> ) : ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" /> </svg> )} </button> {/* Desktop Menu (always visible) */} <div className="hidden sm:flex sm:items-center sm:space-x-8"> <ul className="flex space-x-8"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300 relative"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> {/* Ensure it's on top with z-50 */} <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} // Added click handler > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Sign In Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span> </Link> </li> </ul> </div> {/* Mobile Menu */} <div className={${ isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden" } sm:hidden absolute top-16 left-0 w-full bg-indigo-800} > <ul className="flex flex-col items-center space-y-4 py-4"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Render search inside mobile menu */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Sign In Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span> </Link> </li> </ul> </div> </nav> ); }; export default Nav; now do that
ChatGPT said:

To combine both the search functionality and LandingPage component in the Nav component properly, ensuring that the search modal can be opened from the navbar, I'll provide the steps and code:

  1. Move the LandingPage component: You need to ensure that the LandingPage component remains in the layout while allowing the search functionality to be triggered from the Nav component.
  2. Search Modal: The modal for search is already implemented in the Nav component. The handleSearch function should work as expected.
  3. Triggering Search from Nav: We have the Nav component controlling the search and the LandingPage showing blog posts. You can click on the search icon to open the modal and perform a search.

Updated Implementation

Here's the refined version of your code:

LandingPage.js

javascript
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import featimage from '../assets/featured.jpg';

const LandingPage = ({ searchKeyword }) => {
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [visibleBlogs, setVisibleBlogs] = useState(6); // Initially show 6 blogs

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch("https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?_embed")
      .then((res) => res.json())
      .then((data) => {
        setBlogs(data);
        setLoading(false);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error("Error fetching blogs:", err);
        setLoading(false);
      });
  }, []);

  // Function to decode HTML entities
  const decodeHtml = (html) => {
    const txt = document.createElement("textarea");
    txt.innerHTML = html;
    return txt.value;
  };

  const truncateExcerpt = (excerpt) => {
    const plainText = excerpt.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, ""); // Remove HTML tags
    return plainText.length > 100 ? `${plainText.slice(0, 100)}...` : plainText;
  };

  const toggleBlogs = () => {
    setVisibleBlogs((prev) => (prev === 6 ? blogs.length : 6)); // Toggle between 6 blogs and all blogs
  };

  // Filter the blogs based on search keyword
  const filteredBlogs = searchKeyword
    ? blogs.filter((blog) =>
        blog.title.rendered.toLowerCase().includes(searchKeyword.toLowerCase())
      )
    : blogs;

  if (loading) return <p className="p-6 text-center">Loading articles...</p>;

  return (
    <div className="p-6 lg:px-24 md:px-0">
      {/* Top Image Section */}
      <div className="relative mb-8 mx-2 z-0">
        <img
          src={featimage}
          alt="Featured"
          className="w-full h-80 md:h-96 object-cover rounded-lg"
        />
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-blue-600 opacity-50 rounded-lg"></div>
        <div className="absolute inset-0 flex flex-col justify-center items-center z-20">
          <h2 className="text-white text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold text-center px-4">
            Explore Latest Articles Here, You Are Welcome!
          </h2>
          <p className="text-white text-sm md:text-base mt-2 text-center px-4">
            This site is created by Lokesh Singh Mewari for the SportsDuniya assignment.
          </p>
          <p className="text-white">We are using vedantatimes.com API</p>
        </div>
      </div>

      <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6 text-center">Latest Articles</h1>
      {/* Blue Horizontal Line */}
      <hr className="border-t-2 border-blue-600 mb-6" />

      <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4">
        {filteredBlogs.slice(0, visibleBlogs).map((blog) => {
          const featuredImage =
            blog._embedded?.["wp:featuredmedia"]?.[0]?.source_url;
          const decodedTitle = decodeHtml(blog.title.rendered); // Decode the title

          return (
            <div
              key={blog.id}
              className="border rounded-md p-4 shadow hover:shadow-lg transition"
            >
              {featuredImage && (
                <img
                  src={featuredImage}
                  alt={decodedTitle}
                  className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md mb-4"
                />
              )}
              <h3 className="font-bold text-xl mb-2">{decodedTitle}</h3>
              <p className="text-gray-700 mb-4">
                {truncateExcerpt(blog.excerpt.rendered)}
              </p>
              <Link
                to={`/blogs/${blog.id}`}
                className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-600"
              >
                Read More
              </Link>
            </div>
          );
        })}
      </div>

      {/* Toggle Button */}
      <div className="text-center mt-6">
        <button
          onClick={toggleBlogs}
          className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-600"
        >
          {visibleBlogs === 6 ? "Load More" : "Show Less"}
        </button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default LandingPage;

Nav.js

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons

const Nav = ({ setSearchKeyword }) => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeywordState] = useState(""); // Local state for search keyword

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = () => {
    setSearchKeyword(searchKeyword); // Set the search keyword from the navbar
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 py-4 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-2xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">The Dummy Times</Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Search Link */}
      <div className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
        <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
          <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span>
        </button>

        {isSearchOpen && (
          <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50">
            <input
              type="text"
              value={searchKeyword}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchKeywordState(e.target.value)}
              className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4"
              placeholder="Enter search keyword"
            />
            <button
              onClick={handleSearch}
              className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md"
            >
              Search
            </button>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

Key Updates:

  1. LandingPage: Now accepts a searchKeyword prop. It filters blogs based on the search term.
  2. Nav: Includes the logic for handling search in the navbar. When the search button is clicked, the search results appear in the navbar.
  3. Search Handling: The search term is managed in both components (Nav and LandingPage), with the search results updating in real-time.

Make sure you pass setSearchKeyword properly to both components to allow search filtering.

You said:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import featimage from '../assets/featured.jpg'; const LandingPage = () => { const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); const [visibleBlogs, setVisibleBlogs] = useState(6); // Initially show 6 blogs useEffect(() => { fetch("https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?_embed") .then((res) => res.json()) .then((data) => { setBlogs(data); setLoading(false); }) .catch((err) => { console.error("Error fetching blogs:", err); setLoading(false); }); }, []); // Function to decode HTML entities const decodeHtml = (html) => { const txt = document.createElement("textarea"); txt.innerHTML = html; return txt.value; }; const truncateExcerpt = (excerpt) => { const plainText = excerpt.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, ""); // Remove HTML tags return plainText.length > 100 ? ${plainText.slice(0, 100)}... : plainText; }; const toggleBlogs = () => { setVisibleBlogs((prev) => (prev === 6 ? blogs.length : 6)); // Toggle between 6 blogs and all blogs }; if (loading) return <p className="p-6 text-center">Loading articles...</p>; return ( <div className="p-6 lg:px-24 md:px-0"> {/* Top Image Section */} <div className="relative mb-8 mx-2 z-10"> <img src={featimage} alt="Featured" className="w-full h-80 md:h-96 object-cover rounded-lg" /> <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-blue-600 opacity-50 rounded-lg"></div> <div className="absolute inset-0 flex flex-col justify-center items-center z-20"> <h2 className="text-white text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold text-center px-4"> Explore Latest Articles Here, You Are Welcome! </h2> <p className="text-white text-sm md:text-base mt-2 text-center px-4"> This site is created by Lokesh Singh Mewari for the SportsDuniya assignment. </p> <p className="text-white">We are using vedantatimes.com API</p> </div> </div> <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold mb-6 text-center">Latest Articles</h1> {/* Blue Horizontal Line */} <hr className="border-t-2 border-blue-600 mb-6" /> <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 gap-4"> {blogs.slice(0, visibleBlogs).map((blog) => { const featuredImage = blog._embedded?.["wp:featuredmedia"]?.[0]?.source_url; const decodedTitle = decodeHtml(blog.title.rendered); // Decode the title return ( <div key={blog.id} className="border rounded-md p-4 shadow hover:shadow-lg transition" > {featuredImage && ( <img src={featuredImage} alt={decodedTitle} className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md mb-4" /> )} <h3 className="font-bold text-xl mb-2">{decodedTitle}</h3> {/* Use decoded title */} <p className="text-gray-700 mb-4"> {truncateExcerpt(blog.excerpt.rendered)} </p> <Link to={/blogs/${blog.id}} className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-600" > Read More </Link> </div> ); })} </div> {/* Toggle Button */} <div className="text-center mt-6"> <button onClick={toggleBlogs} className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded hover:bg-blue-600" > {visibleBlogs === 6 ? "Load More" : "Show Less"} </button> </div> </div> ); }; export default LandingPage; import React, { useState } from "react"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons const Nav = () => { const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false); const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState(""); const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]); const toggleMenu = () => { setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen); }; const toggleSearchModal = () => { setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen); }; const handleSearch = async () => { if (searchKeyword.trim()) { const response = await fetch( https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword} ); const data = await response.json(); setSearchResults(data); } }; // Function to handle when a search result is clicked const handleResultClick = (id) => { // Close the search modal setIsSearchOpen(false); // Redirect to the post page window.location.href = /blogs/${id}; }; return ( <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 py-4 flex justify-between items-center relative"> {/* Logo */} <div className="text-2xl font-bold"> <Link to="/">The Dummy Times</Link> </div> {/* Mobile Menu Button */} <button className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none" onClick={toggleMenu} > {isMenuOpen ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} // Added click handler > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Sign In Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span> </Link> </li> </ul> </div> {/* Mobile Menu */} <div className={${ isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden" } sm:hidden absolute top-16 left-0 w-full bg-indigo-800} > <ul className="flex flex-col items-center space-y-4 py-4"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Render search inside mobile menu */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ?
