( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" /> </svg> ) : ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" /> </svg> )} </button> {/* Desktop Menu (always visible) */} <div className="hidden sm:flex sm:items-center sm:space-x-8"> <ul className="flex space-x-8"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300 relative"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> {/* Ensure it's on top with z-50 */} <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} // Added click handler > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Sign In Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span> </Link> </li> </ul> </div> {/* Mobile Menu */} <div className={${ isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden" } sm:hidden absolute top-16 left-0 w-full bg-indigo-800 z-50} > <ul className="flex flex-col items-center space-y-4 py-4"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Render search inside mobile menu */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Sign In Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span> </Link> </li> </ul> </div> </nav> ); }; export default Nav; this is my navbar
ChatGPT said:

To implement the logic where the navbar updates from "Sign In" to "Logout" based on whether the user is logged in or not, you can manage the logged-in state using React's useState. Additionally, you can store this state in localStorage or a context to keep track of the login status.

Here's how you can implement it:

Updated Nav Component:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons

const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [isLoggedIn, setIsLoggedIn] = useState(false); // Track login status

  useEffect(() => {
    // Check if user is logged in by checking localStorage or a global state
    const loggedInStatus = localStorage.getItem("isLoggedIn") === "true";
    setIsLoggedIn(loggedInStatus);
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  const handleLogout = () => {
    // Update the login state and remove the user session from localStorage
    setIsLoggedIn(false);
    localStorage.setItem("isLoggedIn", "false");
  };

  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (always visible) */}
      <div className="hidden sm:flex sm:items-center sm:space-x-8">
        <ul className="flex space-x-8">
          {/* Search Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300 relative">
            <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span>
            </button>
            {isSearchOpen && (
              <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> {/* Ensure it's on top with z-50 */}
                <input
                  type="text"
                  value={searchKeyword}
                  onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
                  className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4"
                  placeholder="Enter search keyword"
                />
                <button
                  onClick={handleSearch}
                  className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md"
                >
                  Search
                </button>

                <div className="mt-4">
                  {searchResults.length > 0 ? (
                    <ul className="space-y-4">
                      {searchResults.map((post) => (
                        <li
                          key={post.id}
                          className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer"
                          onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} // Added click handler
                        >
                          {post.title.rendered}
                        </li>
                      ))}
                    </ul>
                  ) : (
                    <p>No results found</p>
                  )}
                </div>
              </div>
            )}
          </li>

          {/* Dashboard Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span>
            </Link>
          </li>

          {/* Sign In / Logout Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            {isLoggedIn ? (
              <button onClick={handleLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
                <FaSignOutAlt /> <span>Logout</span>
              </button>
            ) : (
              <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2">
                <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span>
              </Link>
            )}
          </li>
        </ul>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu */}
      <div
        className={`${
          isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"
        } sm:hidden absolute top-16 left-0 w-full bg-indigo-800 z-50`}
      >
        <ul className="flex flex-col items-center space-y-4 py-4">
          {/* Search Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span>
            </button>
            {/* Render search inside mobile menu */}
            {isSearchOpen && (
              <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50">
                <input
                  type="text"
                  value={searchKeyword}
                  onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
                  className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4"
                  placeholder="Enter search keyword"
                />
                <button
                  onClick={handleSearch}
                  className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md"
                >
                  Search
                </button>

                <div className="mt-4">
                  {searchResults.length > 0 ? (
                    <ul className="space-y-4">
                      {searchResults.map((post) => (
                        <li
                          key={post.id}
                          className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer"
                          onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)}
                        >
                          {post.title.rendered}
                        </li>
                      ))}
                    </ul>
                  ) : (
                    <p>No results found</p>
                  )}
                </div>
              </div>
            )}
          </li>

          {/* Dashboard Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span>
            </Link>
          </li>

          {/* Sign In / Logout Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            {isLoggedIn ? (
              <button onClick={handleLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
                <FaSignOutAlt /> <span>Logout</span>
              </button>
            ) : (
              <Link to="/login" className="flex items-center space-x-2">
                <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Sign In</span>
              </Link>
            )}
          </li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

Key Changes:

  1. State Management: isLoggedIn is used to track if the user is logged in or not.
  2. Local Storage: When the user logs in or logs out, we store the status in localStorage.
  3. Dynamic Button: Depending on the isLoggedIn state, the "Sign In" link changes to "Logout".
  4. Logout Handler: When the user clicks "Logout", the isLoggedIn state is set to false and the status is updated in localStorage.

This way, when the user logs in or logs out, the navbar will automatically reflect the changes.

You said:
no i want to change the the sign in button on navba to logout if the user is logged in and loging out turns it to signin
ChatGPT said:

To implement the conditional display of "Sign In" or "Log Out" based on whether the user is logged in, you can use a state variable to track the login status of the user. You can set this state when the user logs in or out, and conditionally render the button based on this state.

Heres an updated version of your Nav component with the "Sign In" button changing to "Log Out" when the user is logged in:

  1. Add a isLoggedIn state to track the user's login status.
  2. Handle the login and logout functionality to toggle the login status.
  3. Display the "Log Out" button when the user is logged in and the "Sign In" button when the user is not logged in.

Updated Nav component with login/logout functionality:

jsx
import React, { useState } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons

const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [isLoggedIn, setIsLoggedIn] = useState(false); // Track user login status

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  // Function to handle login/logout toggle
  const handleLoginLogout = () => {
    if (isLoggedIn) {
      // Log out logic here (clear tokens, session, etc.)
      setIsLoggedIn(false);
      // Redirect to login page (optional)
      window.location.href = "/login";
    } else {
      // Log in logic here (set tokens, session, etc.)
      setIsLoggedIn(true);
      // Redirect to dashboard after login (optional)
      window.location.href = "/dashboard";
    }
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (always visible) */}
      <div className="hidden sm:flex sm:items-center sm:space-x-8">
        <ul className="flex space-x-8">
          {/* Search Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300 relative">
            <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span>
            </button>
            {isSearchOpen && (
              <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> {/* Ensure it's on top with z-50 */}
                <input
                  type="text"
                  value={searchKeyword}
                  onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
                  className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4"
                  placeholder="Enter search keyword"
                />
                <button
                  onClick={handleSearch}
                  className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md"
                >
                  Search
                </button>

                <div className="mt-4">
                  {searchResults.length > 0 ? (
                    <ul className="space-y-4">
                      {searchResults.map((post) => (
                        <li
                          key={post.id}
                          className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer"
                          onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} // Added click handler
                        >
                          {post.title.rendered}
                        </li>
                      ))}
                    </ul>
                  ) : (
                    <p>No results found</p>
                  )}
                </div>
              </div>
            )}
          </li>

          {/* Dashboard Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span>
            </Link>
          </li>

          {/* Login/Logout Button */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <button
              onClick={handleLoginLogout}
              className="flex items-center space-x-2"
            >
              {isLoggedIn ? <FaSignOutAlt /> : <FaSignInAlt />}
              <span>{isLoggedIn ? "Log Out" : "Sign In"}</span>
            </button>
          </li>
        </ul>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu */}
      <div
        className={`${
          isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"
        } sm:hidden absolute top-16 left-0 w-full bg-indigo-800 z-50`}
      >
        <ul className="flex flex-col items-center space-y-4 py-4">
          {/* Search Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span>
            </button>
            {/* Render search inside mobile menu */}
            {isSearchOpen && (
              <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50">
                <input
                  type="text"
                  value={searchKeyword}
                  onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
                  className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4"
                  placeholder="Enter search keyword"
                />
                <button
                  onClick={handleSearch}
                  className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md"
                >
                  Search
                </button>

                <div className="mt-4">
                  {searchResults.length > 0 ? (
                    <ul className="space-y-4">
                      {searchResults.map((post) => (
                        <li
                          key={post.id}
                          className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer"
                          onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)}
                        >
                          {post.title.rendered}
                        </li>
                      ))}
                    </ul>
                  ) : (
                    <p>No results found</p>
                  )}
                </div>
              </div>
            )}
          </li>

          {/* Dashboard Link */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2">
              <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span>
            </Link>
          </li>

          {/* Login/Logout Button */}
          <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300">
            <button
              onClick={handleLoginLogout}
              className="flex items-center space-x-2"
            >
              {isLoggedIn ? <FaSignOutAlt /> : <FaSignInAlt />}
              <span>{isLoggedIn ? "Log Out" : "Sign In"}</span>
            </button>
          </li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

Explanation:

  1. isLoggedIn state: Tracks whether the user is logged in or not.
  2. handleLoginLogout function: Handles both login and logout. When logged in, it sets isLoggedIn to false and redirects the user to the login page. When logged out, it sets isLoggedIn to true and redirects the user to the dashboard.
  3. Conditional rendering: The "Sign In" button is displayed when isLoggedIn is false, and the "Log Out" button is displayed when isLoggedIn is true.

This solution allows you to toggle between "Sign In" and "Log Out" depending on the user's authentication state.

You said:
not working ill give you whole code import React, { useState } from 'react'; import logos from '../assets/google.png'; // Make sure to import the Google logo import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'; import Login from '../components/Login'; const LoginPage = () => { const navigate = useNavigate(); const [username, setUsername] = useState(''); const [password, setPassword] = useState(''); const handleLogin = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); console.log("Logging in with: ", { username, password }); navigate("/dashboard"); }; return ( <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-100 py-4"> <div className="w-full max-w-md sm:max-w-sm p-4 sm:p-4 bg-transparent shadow-none"> {/* Login Form */} <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center text-blue-600 mb-4">Login</h2> <form onSubmit={handleLogin}> <div className="mb-4"> <label className="block text-gray-700 font-semibold mb-2" htmlFor="username"> Username </label> <input type="text" id="username" className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-600" placeholder="Enter your username" value={username} onChange={(e) => setUsername(e.target.value)} required /> </div> <div className="mb-6"> <label className="block text-gray-700 font-semibold mb-2" htmlFor="password"> Password </label> <input type="password" id="password" className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-600" placeholder="Enter your password" value={password} onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)} required /> </div> {/* Login Button */} <button type="submit" className="w-full py-3 px-6 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-blue-600 focus:outline-none mb-4" > Login </button> </form> {/* Horizontal Line */} <div className="flex items-center mb-4"> <div className="flex-grow border-t border-blue-500"></div> <span className="mx-2 text-blue-500">OR</span> <div className="flex-grow border-t border-blue-500"></div> </div> {/* Continue with Google Button */} <Login /> </div> </div> ); }; export default LoginPage; import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth'; import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { auth } from './firebase'; import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'; import logos from '../assets/google.png'; import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify"; import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling const Login = () => { const [user, setUser] = useState(null); const navigate = useNavigate(); // Function to handle Google login function googleLogin() { const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider(); signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => { if (result) { toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center" }); setUser(result.user); navigate("/dashboard"); } else { toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center" }); } }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center" }); console.error("Login error:", error); }); } // Function to handle log out function googleLogout() { signOut(auth).then(() => { toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center" }); setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out navigate("/"); }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center" }); console.error("Logout error:", error); }); } // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out) useEffect(() => { const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => { setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes }); // Clean up listener on component unmount return () => unsubscribe(); }, []); return ( <div> {user ? ( // If the user is logged in, show the logout button <button onClick={googleLogout} className="w-full py-3 px-6 flex items-center justify-center bg-red-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-red-600 focus:outline-none" > Log Out </button> ) : ( // If the user is not logged in, show the sign-in button <button onClick={googleLogin} className="w-full py-3 px-6 flex items-center justify-center bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-blue-600 focus:outline-none" > <img src={logos} alt="Google" className="w-6 h-6 mr-3 bg-white rounded-full" /> Continue with Google </button> )} {/* ToastContainer added here */} <ToastContainer /> </div> ); }; export default Login; import React, { useState } from "react"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons const Nav = () => { const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false); const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState(""); const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]); const [isLoggedIn, setIsLoggedIn] = useState(false); // Track user login status const toggleMenu = () => { setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen); }; const toggleSearchModal = () => { setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen); }; const handleSearch = async () => { if (searchKeyword.trim()) { const response = await fetch( https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword} ); const data = await response.json(); setSearchResults(data); } }; // Function to handle when a search result is clicked const handleResultClick = (id) => { // Close the search modal setIsSearchOpen(false); // Redirect to the post page window.location.href = /blogs/${id}; }; // Function to handle login/logout toggle const handleLoginLogout = () => { if (isLoggedIn) { // Log out logic here (clear tokens, session, etc.) setIsLoggedIn(false); // Redirect to login page (optional) window.location.href = "/login"; } else { // Log in logic here (set tokens, session, etc.) setIsLoggedIn(true); // Redirect to dashboard after login (optional) window.location.href = "/dashboard"; } }; return ( <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative"> {/* Logo */} <div className="text-4xl font-bold"> <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link> </div> {/* Mobile Menu Button */} <button className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none" onClick={toggleMenu} > {isMenuOpen ? ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" /> </svg> ) : ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" /> </svg> )} </button> {/* Desktop Menu (always visible) */} <div className="hidden sm:flex sm:items-center sm:space-x-8"> <ul className="flex space-x-8"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300 relative"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> {/* Ensure it's on top with z-50 */} <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} // Added click handler > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Login/Logout Button */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <button onClick={handleLoginLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2" > {isLoggedIn ? <FaSignOutAlt /> : <FaSignInAlt />} <span>{isLoggedIn ? "Log Out" : "Sign In"}</span> </button> </li> </ul> </div> {/* Mobile Menu */} <div className={${ isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden" } sm:hidden absolute top-16 left-0 w-full bg-indigo-800 z-50} > <ul className="flex flex-col items-center space-y-4 py-4"> {/* Search Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Render search inside mobile menu */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="absolute top-12 left-0 w-64 bg-white text-black p-4 rounded-lg shadow-md z-50"> <input type="text" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 mb-4" placeholder="Enter search keyword" /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full bg-indigo-700 text-white py-2 rounded-md" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> {searchResults.length > 0 ? ( <ul className="space-y-4"> {searchResults.map((post) => ( <li key={post.id} className="text-lg hover:text-indigo-700 cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(post.id)} > {post.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> ) : ( <p>No results found</p> )} </div> </div> )} </li> {/* Dashboard Link */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> </li> {/* Login/Logout Button */} <li className="text-white text-lg hover:text-gray-300"> <button onClick={handleLoginLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2" > {isLoggedIn ? <FaSignOutAlt /> : <FaSignInAlt />} <span>{isLoggedIn ? "Log Out" : "Sign In"}</span> </button> </li> </ul> </div> </nav> ); }; export default Nav; now make it work like changing sign in to logout once it is logged in and vice versa and also show toast on success login
ChatGPT said:

Your setup seems to have multiple parts that need to work together (React, Firebase, and routing). There are a few things that might be causing the issues you're experiencing.

Here's a checklist of things to ensure everything works:

  1. Firebase Setup: Ensure your Firebase configuration is set up correctly in firebase.js and that you're exporting auth properly.

    • Example:
      js
      import { initializeApp } from 'firebase/app';
import { getAuth } from 'firebase/auth';

const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: "YOUR_API_KEY",
  authDomain: "YOUR_AUTH_DOMAIN",
  projectId: "YOUR_PROJECT_ID",
  storageBucket: "YOUR_STORAGE_BUCKET",
  messagingSenderId: "YOUR_SENDER_ID",
  appId: "YOUR_APP_ID"
};

const app = initializeApp(firebaseConfig);
export const auth = getAuth(app);

  2. Firebase Auth Provider: Ensure googleLogin() is being triggered properly from the Login component and auth.onAuthStateChanged is correctly monitoring the user's login state. This can be added in the LoginPage or Nav components to manage the login state globally.

  3. Routes: Make sure your routes in react-router-dom are properly configured, including the /dashboard and /login paths. You may also need to protect the /dashboard route by ensuring only authenticated users can access it.

    Example:

    js
    import { BrowserRouter as Router, Route, Routes } from 'react-router-dom';
import LoginPage from './pages/LoginPage';
import Dashboard from './pages/Dashboard';

function App() {
  return (
    <Router>
      <Routes>
        <Route path="/login" element={<LoginPage />} />
        <Route path="/dashboard" element={<Dashboard />} />
        <Route path="/" element={<Home />} />
      </Routes>
    </Router>
  );
}

  4. Toast Container: Ensure ToastContainer is placed at the root of your app or at a place where it's always rendered.

  5. User State Handling: Make sure your Login component has access to the user state, and updates accordingly when the user logs in or logs out. You can pass the user state and handler functions as props to child components or use context for global state management.

  6. Authentication Flow: When logging in through Google, make sure the sign-in function (googleLogin()) is triggered, and on successful login, the state is updated, and the user is navigated to /dashboard.

If your issues persist, I can take a look at specific errors you're seeing in the browser's console or network tab. Let me know!

You said:
write whole codes for 3 components
ChatGPT said:

Certainly! Below is the entire code for the three components, based on the structure you've shared:

1. LoginPage.js

javascript
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';
import Login from '../components/Login';

const LoginPage = () => {

  const navigate = useNavigate();
  
  const [username, setUsername] = useState('');
  const [password, setPassword] = useState('');
  
  const handleLogin = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    console.log("Logging in with: ", { username, password });
    navigate("/dashboard");
  };

  return (
    <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-100 py-4">
      <div className="w-full max-w-md sm:max-w-sm p-4 sm:p-4 bg-transparent shadow-none">
        {/* Login Form */}
        <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center text-blue-600 mb-4">Login</h2>

        <form onSubmit={handleLogin}>
          <div className="mb-4">
            <label className="block text-gray-700 font-semibold mb-2" htmlFor="username">
              Username
            </label>
            <input
              type="text"
              id="username"
              className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-600"
              placeholder="Enter your username"
              value={username}
              onChange={(e) => setUsername(e.target.value)}
              required
            />
          </div>

          <div className="mb-6">
            <label className="block text-gray-700 font-semibold mb-2" htmlFor="password">
              Password
            </label>
            <input
              type="password"
              id="password"
              className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-600"
              placeholder="Enter your password"
              value={password}
              onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
              required
            />
          </div>

          {/* Login Button */}
          <button
            type="submit"
            className="w-full py-3 px-6 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-blue-600 focus:outline-none mb-4"
          >
            Login
          </button>
        </form>

        {/* Horizontal Line */}
        <div className="flex items-center mb-4">
          <div className="flex-grow border-t border-blue-500"></div>
          <span className="mx-2 text-blue-500">OR</span>
          <div className="flex-grow border-t border-blue-500"></div>
        </div>

        {/* Continue with Google Button */}
        <Login />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default LoginPage;

2. Login.js (Google Authentication)

javascript
import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth';
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { auth } from './firebase';
import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';
import logos from '../assets/google.png';
import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify";
import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling

const Login = () => {
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Function to handle Google login
  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center" });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center" });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center" });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Function to handle log out
  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center" });
      setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center" });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out)
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes
    });

    // Clean up listener on component unmount
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  return (
    <div>
      {user ? (
        // If the user is logged in, show the logout button
        <button
          onClick={googleLogout}
          className="w-full py-3 px-6 flex items-center justify-center bg-red-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-red-600 focus:outline-none"
        >
          Log Out
        </button>
      ) : (
        // If the user is not logged in, show the sign-in button
        <button
          onClick={googleLogin}
          className="w-full py-3 px-6 flex items-center justify-center bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-blue-600 focus:outline-none"
        >
          <img
            src={logos}
            alt="Google"
            className="w-6 h-6 mr-3 bg-white rounded-full"
          />
          Continue with Google
        </button>
      )}

      {/* ToastContainer added here */}
      <ToastContainer />
    </div>
  );
};

export default Login;

3. Nav.js (Navigation Bar)

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons

const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [isLoggedIn, setIsLoggedIn] = useState(false); // Track user login status

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  // Function to handle login/logout toggle
  const handleLoginLogout = () => {
    if (isLoggedIn) {
      // Log out logic here (clear tokens, session, etc.)
      setIsLoggedIn(false);
      // Redirect to login page (optional)
      window.location.href = "/login";
    } else {
      // Log in logic here (set tokens, session, etc.)
      setIsLoggedIn(true);
      // Redirect to dashboard after login (optional)
      window.location.href = "/dashboard";
    }
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */}
      <div
        className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${
          isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"
        }`}
      >
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
          <span>Dashboard</span>
        </Link>

        {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */}
        <button
          onClick={handleLoginLogout}
          className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
        >
          {isLoggedIn ? (
            <>
              <FaSignOutAlt />
              <span>Logout</span>
            </>
          ) : (
            <>
              <FaSignInAlt />
              <span>Login</span>
            </>
          )}
        </button>
      </div>
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

This setup includes:

  • LoginPage for the form submission and routing.
  • Login for Google authentication with Firebase.
  • Nav for the navigation bar with a login/logout toggle.

Make sure Firebase is set up correctly with proper credentials, and you have react-router-dom installed for routing and navigation.

You said:
write full nav code
ChatGPT said:

Certainly! Below is the full navigation bar (Nav) code with all the required functionality:

Nav.js (Full Navigation Bar Code)

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons
import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth';
import { auth } from './firebase'; // Assuming you have firebase.js file for auth configuration
import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify";
import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling

const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Function to handle Google login
  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center" });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center" });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center" });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Function to handle log out
  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center" });
      setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center" });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out)
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes
    });

    // Clean up listener on component unmount
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */}
      <div
        className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${
          isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"
        }`}
      >
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
          <span>Dashboard</span>
        </Link>

        {/* Search Button */}
        <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
          <FaSearch />
          <span>Search</span>
        </button>

        {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */}
        {user ? (
          <button
            onClick={googleLogout}
            className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
          >
            <FaSignOutAlt />
            <span>Logout</span>
          </button>
        ) : (
          <button
            onClick={googleLogin}
            className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
          >
            <FaSignInAlt />
            <span>Login</span>
          </button>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Search Modal (conditionally rendered) */}
      {isSearchOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center">
          <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg max-w-lg w-full">
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Search</h3>
            <input
              type="text"
              placeholder="Search for posts"
              className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg mb-4"
              value={searchKeyword}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
            />
            <button
              onClick={handleSearch}
              className="w-full py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg"
            >
              Search
            </button>

            <div className="mt-4">
              <h4 className="font-semibold">Search Results</h4>
              <ul className="mt-2">
                {searchResults.map((result) => (
                  <li
                    key={result.id}
                    className="cursor-pointer text-blue-600"
                    onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)}
                  >
                    {result.title.rendered}
                  </li>
                ))}
              </ul>
            </div>

            {/* Close Search Modal Button */}
            <button
              onClick={toggleSearchModal}
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-lg font-bold"
            >
              X
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      {/* Toast Container for Notifications */}
      <ToastContainer />
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

Key Features:

  1. Google Authentication:

    • Uses Firebase for authentication (Google login/logout).
    • Displays Login or Logout based on authentication state.

  2. Search Functionality:

    • Search modal with live search for blog posts using the WordPress REST API (https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search={keyword}).
    • Displays search results and allows clicking on a result to view the full post.

  3. Responsive Design:

    • Mobile-first design with a toggleable hamburger menu for smaller screens.
    • The sm:hidden class hides elements on mobile, and sm:flex shows them on larger screens.

  4. Conditional Rendering:

    • Conditional rendering of login/logout buttons based on the authentication state (user state).
    • Shows search modal when the search button is clicked.

  5. Toast Notifications:

    • Uses react-toastify for displaying success and error messages for login and logout actions.

Prerequisites:

  1. Firebase Setup: You need to configure Firebase in your project with the auth module for Google authentication.
  2. React Router: Ensure react-router-dom is installed for routing (useNavigate for navigation).
  3. React Icons: Ensure react-icons is installed to use the icons like FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, etc.
  4. WordPress API: The search feature uses the WordPress REST API. Make sure the endpoint https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts is valid and accessible.

This complete Nav.js file includes a dynamic, responsive navigation bar, with features like login/logout, search modal, and Google authentication handling.

You said:
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth'; import { auth } from './firebase'; // Assuming you have firebase.js file for auth configuration import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify"; import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling const Nav = () => { const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false); const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState(""); const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]); const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status const navigate = useNavigate(); // Function to handle Google login function googleLogin() { const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider(); signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => { if (result) { toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center" }); setUser(result.user); navigate("/dashboard"); } else { toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center" }); } }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center" }); console.error("Login error:", error); }); } // Function to handle log out function googleLogout() { signOut(auth).then(() => { toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center" }); setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out navigate("/login"); }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center" }); console.error("Logout error:", error); }); } // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out) useEffect(() => { const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => { setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes }); // Clean up listener on component unmount return () => unsubscribe(); }, []); const toggleMenu = () => { setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen); }; const toggleSearchModal = () => { setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen); }; const handleSearch = async () => { if (searchKeyword.trim()) { const response = await fetch( https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword} ); const data = await response.json(); setSearchResults(data); } }; // Function to handle when a search result is clicked const handleResultClick = (id) => { // Close the search modal setIsSearchOpen(false); // Redirect to the post page window.location.href = /blogs/${id}; }; return ( <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative"> {/* Logo */} <div className="text-4xl font-bold"> <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link> </div> {/* Mobile Menu Button */} <button className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none" onClick={toggleMenu} > {isMenuOpen ? ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" /> </svg> ) : ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" /> </svg> )} </button> {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */} <div className={sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${ isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden" }} > <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> {/* Search Button */} <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */} {user ? ( <button onClick={googleLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg" > <FaSignOutAlt /> <span>Logout</span> </button> ) : ( <button onClick={googleLogin} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg" > <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Login</span> </button> )} </div> {/* Search Modal (conditionally rendered) */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center"> <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg max-w-lg w-full"> <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Search</h3> <input type="text" placeholder="Search for posts" className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg mb-4" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> <h4 className="font-semibold">Search Results</h4> <ul className="mt-2"> {searchResults.map((result) => ( <li key={result.id} className="cursor-pointer text-blue-600" onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)} > {result.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> </div> {/* Close Search Modal Button */} <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-lg font-bold" > X </button> </div> </div> )} {/* Toast Container for Notifications */} <ToastContainer /> </nav> ); }; export default Nav; why the search dashboard and signin in the center align it the right of navbar for desktop
ChatGPT said:

To align the "Search", "Dashboard", and "Sign In/Sign Out" buttons to the right of the navbar for desktop, you need to adjust the styling of the desktop menu items. Right now, it seems like the default alignment is causing these elements to appear centered.

You can achieve the desired right alignment by modifying the div that contains these elements. Here's how you can do it:

  1. Ensure the flex container for the desktop menu (sm:flex) is set to justify-between or justify-end.
  2. Use ml-auto to push the elements to the right.

Here's how you can adjust the code:

Updated Code Snippet

jsx
<div
  className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${
    isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"
  } sm:ml-auto`} // Add `sm:ml-auto` to push the items to the right
>
  <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
    <FaTachometerAlt />
    <span>Dashboard</span>
  </Link>

  {/* Search Button */}
  <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
    <FaSearch />
    <span>Search</span>
  </button>

  {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */}
  {user ? (
    <button
      onClick={googleLogout}
      className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
    >
      <FaSignOutAlt />
      <span>Logout</span>
    </button>
  ) : (
    <button
      onClick={googleLogin}
      className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
    >
      <FaSignInAlt />
      <span>Login</span>
    </button>
  )}
</div>

Explanation:

  • sm:ml-auto: This utility class will push the menu items to the right on desktop screens (when the screen size is sm or larger).
  • The rest of the layout is controlled by sm:flex to display the items as flex on larger screens, and space-x-6 ensures there is space between the items.
You said:
write full code and make sure the tost is hidden once cut and after 3 seconds auto
ChatGPT said:

Here is the full code for your Nav component, with the necessary adjustments to align the "Dashboard", "Search", and "Sign In/Sign Out" buttons to the right of the navbar for desktop. Additionally, I've ensured that the toast notifications will automatically hide after 3 seconds and can be manually closed.

jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons
import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth';
import { auth } from './firebase'; // Assuming you have firebase.js file for auth configuration
import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify";
import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling

const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Function to handle Google login
  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 3000 });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 3000 });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 3000 });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Function to handle log out
  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 3000 });
      setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 3000 });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out)
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes
    });

    // Clean up listener on component unmount
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */}
      <div
        className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"} sm:ml-auto`} // Align items to the right
      >
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
          <span>Dashboard</span>
        </Link>

        {/* Search Button */}
        <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
          <FaSearch />
          <span>Search</span>
        </button>

        {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */}
        {user ? (
          <button
            onClick={googleLogout}
            className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
          >
            <FaSignOutAlt />
            <span>Logout</span>
          </button>
        ) : (
          <button
            onClick={googleLogin}
            className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"
          >
            <FaSignInAlt />
            <span>Login</span>
          </button>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Search Modal (conditionally rendered) */}
      {isSearchOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center">
          <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg max-w-lg w-full">
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Search</h3>
            <input
              type="text"
              placeholder="Search for posts"
              className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg mb-4"
              value={searchKeyword}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
            />
            <button
              onClick={handleSearch}
              className="w-full py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg"
            >
              Search
            </button>

            <div className="mt-4">
              <h4 className="font-semibold">Search Results</h4>
              <ul className="mt-2">
                {searchResults.map((result) => (
                  <li
                    key={result.id}
                    className="cursor-pointer text-blue-600"
                    onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)}
                  >
                    {result.title.rendered}
                  </li>
                ))}
              </ul>
            </div>

            {/* Close Search Modal Button */}
            <button
              onClick={toggleSearchModal}
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-lg font-bold"
            >
              X
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      {/* Toast Container for Notifications */}
      <ToastContainer
        autoClose={3000} // Auto close toast after 3 seconds
        hideProgressBar={true} // Hide progress bar
        closeButton={false} // Remove close button
        pauseOnHover={false} // Disable pausing on hover
      />
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

Key Changes:

  1. Toast Settings:

    • The ToastContainer has been updated with autoClose={3000}, which ensures that the toast disappears after 3 seconds.
    • I've also set hideProgressBar={true}, closeButton={false}, and pauseOnHover={false} to streamline the toast experience.

  2. Right Aligning the Menu:

    • I added sm:ml-auto to the class for the desktop menu to align the menu items to the right of the navbar on larger screens.

This setup ensures that your toast notifications are hidden after 3 seconds, and the menu items are aligned properly on the right for desktop screens.

You said:
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth'; import { auth } from './firebase'; // Assuming you have firebase.js file for auth configuration import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify"; import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling const Nav = () => { const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false); const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState(""); const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]); const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status const navigate = useNavigate(); // Function to handle Google login function googleLogin() { const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider(); signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => { if (result) { toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); setUser(result.user); navigate("/dashboard"); } else { toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); } }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); console.error("Login error:", error); }); } // Function to handle log out function googleLogout() { signOut(auth).then(() => { toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out navigate("/login"); }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); console.error("Logout error:", error); }); } // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out) useEffect(() => { const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => { setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes }); // Clean up listener on component unmount return () => unsubscribe(); }, []); const toggleMenu = () => { setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen); }; const toggleSearchModal = () => { setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen); }; const handleSearch = async () => { if (searchKeyword.trim()) { const response = await fetch( https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword} ); const data = await response.json(); setSearchResults(data); } }; // Function to handle when a search result is clicked const handleResultClick = (id) => { // Close the search modal setIsSearchOpen(false); // Redirect to the post page window.location.href = /blogs/${id}; }; return ( <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative"> {/* Logo */} <div className="text-4xl font-bold"> <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link> </div> {/* Mobile Menu Button */} <button className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none" onClick={toggleMenu} > {isMenuOpen ? ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" /> </svg> ) : ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" /> </svg> )} </button> {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */} <div className={sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"} sm:ml-auto} // Align items to the right > <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> {/* Search Button */} <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */} {user ? ( <button onClick={googleLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg" > <FaSignOutAlt /> <span>Logout</span> </button> ) : ( <button onClick={googleLogin} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg" > <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Login</span> </button> )} </div> {/* Search Modal (conditionally rendered) */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center"> <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg max-w-lg w-full"> <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Search</h3> <input type="text" placeholder="Search for posts" className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg mb-4" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> <h4 className="font-semibold">Search Results</h4> <ul className="mt-2"> {searchResults.map((result) => ( <li key={result.id} className="cursor-pointer text-blue-600" onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)} > {result.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> </div> {/* Close Search Modal Button */} <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-lg font-bold" > X </button> </div> </div> )} {/* Toast Container for Notifications */} <ToastContainer autoClose={3000} // Auto close toast after 3 seconds hideProgressBar={true} // Hide progress bar closeButton={false} // Remove close button pauseOnHover={false} // Disable pausing on hover /> </nav> ); }; export default Nav; dont change anything just do one thing the menu button is visible in center in mob align it to right
ChatGPT said:

To align the menu button to the right in mobile view, you just need to add the class ml-auto to the button for the mobile menu. This will push the button to the right side.

Here is the updated code for the mobile menu button:

jsx
<button
  className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none ml-auto"
  onClick={toggleMenu}
>
  {isMenuOpen ? (
    <svg
      xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
      className="w-6 h-6"
      fill="none"
      viewBox="0 0 24 24"
      stroke="currentColor"
      strokeWidth={2}
    >
      <path
        strokeLinecap="round"
        strokeLinejoin="round"
        d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
      />
    </svg>
  ) : (
    <svg
      xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
      className="w-6 h-6"
      fill="none"
      viewBox="0 0 24 24"
      stroke="currentColor"
      strokeWidth={2}
    >
      <path
        strokeLinecap="round"
        strokeLinejoin="round"
        d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
      />
    </svg>
  )}
</button>

The class ml-auto added to the button will ensure that it is aligned to the right in the mobile view.

You said:
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom"; import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa"; // Importing the icons from react-icons import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth'; import { auth } from './firebase'; // Assuming you have firebase.js file for auth configuration import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify"; import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css'; // Ensure this is imported for styling const Nav = () => { const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false); const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState(""); const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]); const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status const navigate = useNavigate(); // Function to handle Google login function googleLogin() { const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider(); signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => { if (result) { toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); setUser(result.user); navigate("/dashboard"); } else { toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); } }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); console.error("Login error:", error); }); } // Function to handle log out function googleLogout() { signOut(auth).then(() => { toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out navigate("/login"); }).catch((error) => { toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 }); console.error("Logout error:", error); }); } // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out) useEffect(() => { const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => { setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes }); // Clean up listener on component unmount return () => unsubscribe(); }, []); const toggleMenu = () => { setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen); }; const toggleSearchModal = () => { setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen); }; const handleSearch = async () => { if (searchKeyword.trim()) { const response = await fetch( https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword} ); const data = await response.json(); setSearchResults(data); } }; // Function to handle when a search result is clicked const handleResultClick = (id) => { // Close the search modal setIsSearchOpen(false); // Redirect to the post page window.location.href = /blogs/${id}; }; return ( <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative"> {/* Logo */} <div className="text-4xl font-bold"> <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link> </div> {/* Mobile Menu Button */} <button className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none ml-auto" onClick={toggleMenu} > {isMenuOpen ? ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" /> </svg> ) : ( <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2} > <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" /> </svg> )} </button> {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */} <div className={sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"} sm:ml-auto} // Align items to the right > <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg"> <FaTachometerAlt /> <span>Dashboard</span> </Link> {/* Search Button */} <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2"> <FaSearch /> <span>Search</span> </button> {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */} {user ?
