( <button onClick={googleLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg" > <FaSignOutAlt /> <span>Logout</span> </button> ) : ( <button onClick={googleLogin} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg" > <FaSignInAlt /> <span>Login</span> </button> )} </div> {/* Search Modal (conditionally rendered) */} {isSearchOpen && ( <div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center"> <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg max-w-lg w-full"> <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Search</h3> <input type="text" placeholder="Search for posts" className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg mb-4" value={searchKeyword} onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)} /> <button onClick={handleSearch} className="w-full py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg" > Search </button> <div className="mt-4"> <h4 className="font-semibold">Search Results</h4> <ul className="mt-2"> {searchResults.map((result) => ( <li key={result.id} className="cursor-pointer text-blue-600" onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)} > {result.title.rendered} </li> ))} </ul> </div> {/* Close Search Modal Button */} <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-lg font-bold" > X </button> </div> </div> )} {/* Toast Container for Notifications */} <ToastContainer autoClose={3000} // Auto close toast after 3 seconds hideProgressBar={true} // Hide progress bar closeButton={false} // Remove close button pauseOnHover={false} // Disable pausing on hover /> </nav> ); }; export default Nav; fix this navbar , the menu is not droping down its just visible inside the nav strip and wrapping itself
ChatGPT said:

The issue you're facing with the dropdown menu not appearing as expected is likely because of CSS styles that are affecting the display behavior. Specifically, the mobile menu button (<button>) is toggling the visibility of the menu, but the menu itself may not be positioned correctly or styled for dropdown behavior. To fix this, we need to ensure the mobile menu appears properly when toggled.

Here are a few suggestions to fix the dropdown menu behavior:

  1. Ensure that the div containing the mobile menu has position: absolute or position: fixed so it can drop down below the navigation bar.
  2. Adjust the z-index to ensure it appears on top of other content.
  3. Make sure the mobile menu has proper styling to be shown when the menu button is clicked.

Heres an updated version of your code with the necessary changes:

Updated Code

jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react";
import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import { FaSearch, FaTachometerAlt, FaSignInAlt, FaSignOutAlt } from "react-icons/fa";
import { GoogleAuthProvider, signInWithPopup, signOut } from 'firebase/auth';
import { auth } from './firebase';
import { toast, ToastContainer } from "react-toastify";
import 'react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css';

const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null); 
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      setUser(null);
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user);
    });

    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none ml-auto"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2}>
            <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12" />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" className="w-6 h-6" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" strokeWidth={2}>
            <path strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round" d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16" />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu */}
      <div className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block absolute bg-indigo-700 top-full left-0 right-0 sm:hidden z-50 py-4 px-6" : "hidden sm:flex"}`}>
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
          <span>Dashboard</span>
        </Link>

        <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
          <FaSearch />
          <span>Search</span>
        </button>

        {user ? (
          <button onClick={googleLogout} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
            <FaSignOutAlt />
            <span>Logout</span>
          </button>
        ) : (
          <button onClick={googleLogin} className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
            <FaSignInAlt />
            <span>Login</span>
          </button>
        )}
      </div>

      {isSearchOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center">
          <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-lg max-w-lg w-full">
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Search</h3>
            <input
              type="text"
              placeholder="Search for posts"
              className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg mb-4"
              value={searchKeyword}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
            />
            <button
              onClick={handleSearch}
              className="w-full py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg"
            >
              Search
            </button>
            <div className="mt-4">
              <h4 className="font-semibold">Search Results</h4>
              <ul className="mt-2">
                {searchResults.map((result) => (
                  <li
                    key={result.id}
                    className="cursor-pointer text-blue-600"
                    onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)}
                  >
                    {result.title.rendered}
                  </li>
                ))}
              </ul>
            </div>
            <button
              onClick={toggleSearchModal}
              className="absolute top-2 right-2 text-lg font-bold"
            >
              X
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}

      <ToastContainer
        autoClose={3000}
        hideProgressBar={true}
        closeButton={false}
        pauseOnHover={false}
      />
    </nav>
  );
};

export default Nav;

Key Fixes:

  1. Mobile Menu: I added the classes absolute bg-indigo-700 top-full left-0 right-0 sm:hidden z-50 py-4 px-6 to the div containing the mobile menu. This ensures that when the menu is toggled, it appears as a dropdown below the navigation bar.
  2. Responsive Menu Toggle: I used sm:hidden to hide the mobile menu in larger screens, and block sm:flex to control its visibility in smaller screens.
  3. Z-index: The z-50 class ensures the dropdown menu appears on top of other content.
You said:
now all is fine but in mobile version the meu elements are visble in left but they should be in center and but in desktop they are in center but should visible in right
ChatGPT said:

To fix the issue where the mobile menu items should be centered, and in desktop view, the items should be aligned to the right, we can adjust the CSS classes and the layout structure. Heres the plan:

  1. In mobile view, the menu should be centered, so we can use Flexbox properties to align the menu items in the center.
  2. In desktop view, the menu should be aligned to the right, so we can make sure the menu is placed correctly using Flexbox for alignment.

Let's update the code:

javascript
const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Function to handle Google login
  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Function to handle log out
  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out)
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes
    });

    // Clean up listener on component unmount
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none ml-auto"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */}
      <div
        className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"} sm:ml-auto justify-center sm:justify-end`} // Align items to the right in desktop, center in mobile
      >
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
You said:
write full
ChatGPT said:

Here is the complete code for your navigation component with the mobile menu items centered and the desktop menu items aligned to the right:

javascript
const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Function to handle Google login
  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Function to handle log out
  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out)
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes
    });

    // Clean up listener on component unmount
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none ml-auto"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */}
      <div
        className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"} sm:ml-auto justify-center sm:justify-end`} // Align items to the right in desktop, center in mobile
      >
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
          <span>Dashboard</span>
        </Link>

        {/* Search Button */}
        <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
          <FaSearch />
          <span>Search</span>
        </button>

        {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */}
        {user ? (
          <button onClick={googleLogout} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
            <FaSignOutAlt />
            <span>Logout</span>
          </button>
        ) : (
          <button onClick={googleLogin} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
            <FaSignInAlt />
            <span>Login</span>
          </button>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu (conditional display) */}
      {isMenuOpen && (
        <div className="sm:hidden absolute left-0 top-16 bg-indigo-700 w-full text-center py-4">
          <Link to="/dashboard" className="block text-lg py-2">
            Dashboard
          </Link>
          <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="block text-lg py-2">
            Search
          </button>
          {user ? (
            <button onClick={googleLogout} className="block text-lg py-2">
              Logout
            </button>
          ) : (
            <button onClick={googleLogin} className="block text-lg py-2">
              Login
            </button>
          )}
        </div>
      )}

      {/* Search Modal */}
      {isSearchOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center z-10">
          <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-md w-96">
            <input
              type="text"
              value={searchKeyword}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
              className="w-full p-2 border rounded-md"
              placeholder="Search..."
            />
            <button
              onClick={handleSearch}
              className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-md mt-2 w-full"
            >
              Search
            </button>
            {searchResults.length > 0 && (
              <ul className="mt-4">
                {searchResults.map((result) => (
                  <li key={result.id} className="cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)}>
                    {result.title.rendered}
                  </li>
                ))}
              </ul>
            )}
            <button
              onClick={toggleSearchModal}
              className="text-red-500 mt-4 w-full text-center"
            >
              Close
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}
    </nav>
  );
};

Key changes:

  1. Mobile menu items centered: For the mobile menu, the menu container (sm:hidden) is now centered using justify-center class. This aligns the items to the center when the menu is open on small screens.
  2. Desktop menu items right-aligned: In the desktop view (sm:flex), the items are aligned to the right using sm:justify-end, making the items align right on larger screens.
  3. Conditional rendering of menu: The mobile menu (sm:hidden) is displayed when isMenuOpen is true, and it is hidden when false. The desktop menu (sm:flex) is always shown unless the mobile menu is open.

This solution ensures that the navigation works as expected across both mobile and desktop screens.

You said:
no not working all is fine but the menu is not droping and make sure the elemnts stay in center of menu list
ChatGPT said:

To ensure the menu drops down properly on mobile and the elements stay centered within the menu list, you need to adjust the structure and the way the mobile menu appears. The issue might be due to how the mobile menu is toggled, and we can fix it by ensuring the elements are properly centered.

Here's a revised version of the code that should address the issue of centering the elements in the mobile dropdown and fixing the menu behavior:

Revised Code:

javascript
const Nav = () => {
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isSearchOpen, setIsSearchOpen] = useState(false);
  const [searchKeyword, setSearchKeyword] = useState("");
  const [searchResults, setSearchResults] = useState([]);
  const [user, setUser] = useState(null); // Track user authentication status
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  // Function to handle Google login
  function googleLogin() {
    const provider = new GoogleAuthProvider();
    signInWithPopup(auth, provider).then((result) => {
      if (result) {
        toast.success("User Logged in Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
        setUser(result.user);
        navigate("/dashboard");
      } else {
        toast.error("Login Failed!", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      }
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during login", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Login error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Function to handle log out
  function googleLogout() {
    signOut(auth).then(() => {
      toast.success("User Logged Out Successfully", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      setUser(null); // Update the state when the user logs out
      navigate("/login");
    }).catch((error) => {
      toast.error("An error occurred during logout", { position: "top-center", autoClose: 1000 });
      console.error("Logout error:", error);
    });
  }

  // Listen for authentication state changes (log in or log out)
  useEffect(() => {
    const unsubscribe = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) => {
      setUser(user); // Set the user state whenever the auth state changes
    });

    // Clean up listener on component unmount
    return () => unsubscribe();
  }, []);

  const toggleMenu = () => {
    setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);
  };

  const toggleSearchModal = () => {
    setIsSearchOpen(!isSearchOpen);
  };

  const handleSearch = async () => {
    if (searchKeyword.trim()) {
      const response = await fetch(
        `https://vedantatimes.com/wp-json/wp/v2/posts?search=${searchKeyword}`
      );
      const data = await response.json();
      setSearchResults(data);
    }
  };

  // Function to handle when a search result is clicked
  const handleResultClick = (id) => {
    // Close the search modal
    setIsSearchOpen(false);
    // Redirect to the post page
    window.location.href = `/blogs/${id}`;
  };

  return (
    <nav className="bg-indigo-700 text-white px-6 sm:px-24 py-4 sm:py-6 flex justify-between items-center relative">
      {/* Logo */}
      <div className="text-4xl font-bold">
        <Link to="/">VT<span className="text-green-500 ">.</span></Link>
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu Button */}
      <button
        className="sm:hidden text-white focus:outline-none ml-auto"
        onClick={toggleMenu}
      >
        {isMenuOpen ? (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M6 18L18 6M6 6l12 12"
            />
          </svg>
        ) : (
          <svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            className="w-6 h-6"
            fill="none"
            viewBox="0 0 24 24"
            stroke="currentColor"
            strokeWidth={2}
          >
            <path
              strokeLinecap="round"
              strokeLinejoin="round"
              d="M4 6h16M4 12h16M4 18h16"
            />
          </svg>
        )}
      </button>

      {/* Desktop Menu (conditionally rendered) */}
      <div
        className={`sm:flex items-center space-x-6 ${isMenuOpen ? "block" : "hidden"} sm:ml-auto justify-center sm:justify-end`} // Align items to the right in desktop, center in mobile
      >
        <Link to="/dashboard" className="flex items-center space-x-2 text-lg">
          <FaTachometerAlt />
          <span>Dashboard</span>
        </Link>

        {/* Search Button */}
        <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
          <FaSearch />
          <span>Search</span>
        </button>

        {/* Conditional Login/Logout Button */}
        {user ? (
          <button onClick={googleLogout} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
            <FaSignOutAlt />
            <span>Logout</span>
          </button>
        ) : (
          <button onClick={googleLogin} className="text-lg flex items-center space-x-2">
            <FaSignInAlt />
            <span>Login</span>
          </button>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Menu (conditional display) */}
      {isMenuOpen && (
        <div className="sm:hidden absolute left-0 top-16 bg-indigo-700 w-full text-center py-4 flex flex-col items-center">
          <Link to="/dashboard" className="block text-lg py-2">
            Dashboard
          </Link>
          <button onClick={toggleSearchModal} className="block text-lg py-2">
            Search
          </button>
          {user ? (
            <button onClick={googleLogout} className="block text-lg py-2">
              Logout
            </button>
          ) : (
            <button onClick={googleLogin} className="block text-lg py-2">
              Login
            </button>
          )}
        </div>
      )}

      {/* Search Modal */}
      {isSearchOpen && (
        <div className="fixed inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex justify-center items-center z-10">
          <div className="bg-white p-6 rounded-md w-96">
            <input
              type="text"
              value={searchKeyword}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchKeyword(e.target.value)}
              className="w-full p-2 border rounded-md"
              placeholder="Search..."
            />
            <button
              onClick={handleSearch}
              className="bg-blue-500 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-md mt-2 w-full"
            >
              Search
            </button>
            {searchResults.length > 0 && (
              <ul className="mt-4">
                {searchResults.map((result) => (
                  <li key={result.id} className="cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleResultClick(result.id)}>
                    {result.title.rendered}
                  </li>
                ))}
              </ul>
            )}
            <button
              onClick={toggleSearchModal}
              className="text-red-500 mt-4 w-full text-center"
            >
              Close
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
      )}
    </nav>
  );
};

Key Changes:

  1. Centered Mobile Menu Items: For the mobile menu (visible when isMenuOpen is true), I used flex flex-col items-center to ensure the items are vertically centered in the dropdown list.

  2. Ensuring Mobile Dropdown is Positioned Properly: I used absolute left-0 top-16 w-full to ensure that the dropdown appears just below the navbar when the menu button is clicked.

  3. Menu Toggling: The menu button will now toggle between open and close states when clicked, and the menu dropdown will be centered with the links arranged vertically.

This should now fix the issue where the menu is not dropping correctly and ensure the mobile menu items are centered. In the desktop view, the menu will still be aligned to the right as you wanted.

import React, { useState } from 'react';

import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';

import Login from '../components/Login';

const LoginPage = () => {

const navigate = useNavigate();

const [username, setUsername] = useState('');

const [password, setPassword] = useState('');

const handleLogin = (e) => {

e.preventDefault();

console.log("Logging in with: ", { username, password });

navigate("/dashboard");

};

return (

<div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-100 py-4">

<div className="w-full max-w-md sm:max-w-sm p-4 sm:p-4 bg-transparent shadow-none">

{/* Login Form */}

<h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-center text-blue-600 mb-4">Login</h2>

<form onSubmit={handleLogin}>

<div className="mb-4">

<label className="block text-gray-700 font-semibold mb-2" htmlFor="username">

Username

</label>

<input

type="text"

id="username"

className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-600"

placeholder="Enter your username"

value={username}

onChange={(e) => setUsername(e.target.value)}

required

/>

</div>

<div className="mb-6">

<label className="block text-gray-700 font-semibold mb-2" htmlFor="password">

Password

</label>

<input

type="password"

id="password"

className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-600"

placeholder="Enter your password"

value={password}

onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}

required

/>

</div>

{/* Login Button */}

<button

type="submit"

className="w-full py-3 px-6 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-lg shadow-md hover:bg-blue-600 focus:outline-none mb-4"

>

Login

</button>

</form>

{/* Horizontal Line */}

<div className="flex items-center mb-4">

<div className="flex-grow border-t border-blue-500"></div>

<span className="mx-2 text-blue-500">OR</span>

<div className="flex-grow border-t border-blue-500"></div>

</div>

{/* Continue with Google Button */}

<Login />

</div>

</div>

);

};

export default LoginPage;


O
ChatGPT can make mistakes. Check important info.
